data_findings.finding: This is a 2D polygon packing optimization problem: pack 1-200 Christmas tree shapes into smallest square box. Score = sum of (s_n^2 / n) for all N. Tree shape is 15-vertex polygon with 0.7 base width, 1.0 total height. Target score: 68.95

Key approaches from kernels: 1) Ensemble best solutions from multiple sources, 2) Simulated Annealing with 8 move types (translation, rotation, swap, centroid move, corner tree focus, coordinated move), 3) Grid placement as baseline (88.33 score), 4) C++ implementation for speed
Grid placement strategy: Alternating rows with trees at 0 and 180 degrees, spacing 0.7 horizontally, 1.0 vertically. This achieves ~88.33 baseline score. Zaburo kernel shows this approach.

CRITICAL: Overlap validation must use ZERO tolerance. Previous experiments failed because overlap threshold (1e-15) was too lenient - Kaggle detected overlaps of 3.47e-13. Use proper polygon intersection checking.
